snippet: The American Embassy School, popular with expatriates in New Delhi, is facing questions from the Indian government in the latest volley in its diplomatic spat with the United States.
abstract: American Embassy School, popular with expatriates in New Delhi, is criticized for suggesting female instructors should not state they work on their visa application if their husband also teaches there; apparently illegal advice ensnares school in growing diplomatic spat between India and US over arrest of Indian consular official Devyani Khobragade on visa fraud charges; Indian diplomats appear to be using school as excuse to uncover similar violations by American diplomats.

byline.original: By GARDINER HARRIS and BENJAMIN WEISER
byline.contributor: Gardiner Harris reported from New Delhi, and Benjamin Weiser from New York. Neha Thirani Bagri contributed reporting from Mumbai, India.

lead_paragraph: The American Embassy School, popular with expatriates in New Delhi, is facing questions from the Indian government in the latest volley in its diplomatic spat with the United States.

headline.main: School in India Ensnared in U.S. Diplomatic Spat
